text:
That's the mystery. If I laboriously step through Event Viewer and other log
files the sequence and timing of 'what I did' is consistent with my explanation.
I've used Win10 22H2 on other devices and this Surface 3(maybe others too, but I
rarely see any reports of people still using a Surface 3) has had its uniqueness
with installing updates. 1. Windows Update doesn't automatically inform that
current month updates are available or being downloaded or ready for install.
-i.e. requires me to 'Check for Updates'. Takes a lot longer to check for
updates(sometimes up to 15-20 min. - possibly the Atom CPU or the 4 GB RAM,
since free space on the Windows partition is adequate) 2. Feature Updates don't
install (iirc since Version 1909 or 2004) via Windows Update or USB
media(running setup.exe and keeping files) or the online Upgrade Assistant(but
since 22H2 is the last Win10, that won't be a problem in the future - no more
Feature updates) - what has consistently worked for Feature updates is to create
the ISO, mount it, and copy its entire folder structure to a new folder on the
root of the C:\ drive, unmount the ISO, then then run setup.exe from that folder
on C:\ and keeping files and programs. 3. Office 2019 H&B updates install
without any issue 4. Application program's and MSFT Store app's updates install
without any issue ...w

metadata.topic: Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free? Yes? No? and what about checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused)
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free? Yes? No? and what about checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused)
metadata.email_text_original:
That's the mystery. If I laboriously step through Event Viewer and other log

without any issue ...w -----Original Message----- From:
patchmanagement@googlegroups.com On Behalf Of Shawn K. Hall Sent: January 28,
2024 3:40 AM To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com Subject: RE: [patchmanagement]
Win11 22h2 and later - they don't need 250 free? Yes? No? and what about
checking if you are patched? (aka I'm confused) Any guesses why the update
failed originally? It looks like it checked all the boxes so there shouldn't
have been any problem. How I wish errors returned useful error messages. -S >
-----Original Message----- >
Link: None
